intro: Dianthera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Dianthera parviflora is often found in rocky or clay soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
